newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai requires more details on listed firms.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai requires more details on listed firms.

text.p: The Shanghai stock exchange has ordered listed companies to provide more and fuller information in their annual reports due for release by April 30, the Shanghai Securities News said on Tuesday.

The exchange at a meeting on Monday decided that all listed firms, from now on, must give full details of rights and bonus issues, new share issues and other events which result in changes in share capital, the newspaper said.

The exchange also ruled that where auditors expressed reservations about the 1995 report of any company, that company must this year give details of measures taken during 1996 to resolve the differences.
Listed firms are also required to report the details of all shareholders' meetings during the year and of the interim returns to investors, the newspaper said.
